name: OMNITRAX, INC.
description: Short line and regional freight railroad holding company
sampleDescriptions: H.R. 721/S.407 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit.  Issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER and INFRA grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, and Colorado.  No bill number - Support for Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing project optimization within U.S. DOT
H.R. 721/S.407 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit.

No bill number - Administrative issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER and INFRA grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, and Colorado.  Opposition to increased truck size and weight in FY2018 appropriations bills.
Support for fair and equitable treatment of U.S. investors in Canadian rail transportation infrastructure such as the Hudson Bay Railway Company.

H.R. 721/S.407 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit.  Issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER, INFRA, CRISI, FASTLANE, and BUILD grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, Texas, and Colorado.  No bill number - Support for Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing project optimization within U.S. DOT.  Support for approval of short line rail acquisitions in Georgia and Alabama.

No bill number - Administrative issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER, CRISI, BUILD, FASTLANE, and INFRA grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, Texas, and Colorado.  Opposition to increased truck size and weight in FY2019 appropriations bills.

H.R. 721/S.407 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit.  Issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER, INFRA, CRISI, FASTLANE, and BUILD grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, Texas, and Colorado; Support for and implementation of FY2018 FHWA intermodal grants and CRISI Positive Train Control grants in Illinois.  No bill number - Support for Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing project optimization within U.S. DOT. No bill number - support for the federal approval of the acquisition of railroads in New York state.

No bill number - Administrative issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER, CRISI, BUILD, FASTLANE, and INFRA grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, Texas, and Colorado; Support for and implementation of FY2018 FHWA intermodal grants and CRISI Positive Train Control grants in Illinois.  Opposition to increased truck size and weight in FY2019 appropriations bills.

H.R. 721/S.407/H.R. 88/H.Res. 1180/H.Res. 1160 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit. No bill number - Introduction of BRACE Act for 116th Congress.  Issues related to the implementation of the Positive Train Control mandate found at 49 USC 20157, etc.  Support for federal infrastructure financing under 45 USC 821, etc.  Support for and implementation of FY2017 and FY2018 U.S. DOT TIGER, INFRA, CRISI, FASTLANE, and BUILD grant opportunities in Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Nebraska, Texas, and Colorado; Support for and implementation of FY2018 FHWA intermodal grants and CRISI Positive Train Control grants in Illinois.  No bill number - Support for Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing project optimization within U.S. DOT. No bill number - support for the federal approval of the acquisition of railroads in New York state.
H.R. 721/S.407/H.R. 88/H.Res. 1180/H.Res. 1160 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act - extend and make permanent the Section 45G railroad track maintenance credit.

-- H.R. 510 / S. 203 - Building Rail Access for Customers and the Economy Act of 2019 or the BRACE Act of 2019, solicit cosponsors and propose legislative language
-- No bill number - Tax Extenders Legislation - support inclusion of the BRACE Act in pending draft tax legislation 
-- No bill number - Support finalization of grant agreements for infrastructure projects in Florida and Georgia awarded funding under 23 U.S.C. 117
-- No bill number - Support finalization of grant agreements for infrastructure projects awarded in Texas and Illinois awarded funding under 49 U.S.C. 22907
-- No bill number - Support pending grant applications for infrastructure projects in Colorado, Nebraska, and Oklahoma under 23 U.S.C. 117
-- No bill number - Support pending grant applications for infrastructure projects in Colorado, Nebraska, and Oklahoma under 49 U.S.C. 22907
-- No bill number - Support pending grant applications for infrastructure projects in Colorado, Nebraska, Oklahoma, and Texas under the Better Utilizing Investments to Leverage Development (BUILD) Transportation Grants program
-- No bill number - Support applications for federal infrastructure financing under 45 U.S.C. 821, etc.
-- No bill number - Draft transportation re-authorization and infrastructure bills - Support legislative amendments to streamline infrastructure project financing applications under 45 U.S.C. 821, etc. and 49 U.S.C. 22907
-- No bill number - FY2020 Appropriations bills - oppose truck size and weight increases, support funding for projects under the BUILD program, 45 U.S.C. 821, etc., 23 U.S.C. 117 and 49 U.S.C. 22907
